alert.note: Alert for Estill (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 10:51PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Owsley, southeastern Estill, northwestern Breathitt, Lee and Wolfe Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1050 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pine Ridge to Fincastle to near Old Orchard. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Campton, Vada, Primrose, Calaboose, Airedale, High Falls, Monica, St. Helens and Grannie around 1055 PM EDT. Fillmore, Baptist, Williba, Widecreek, Stillwater, Canyon Falls, Vortex, Trent, Flat and Tallega around 1100 PM EDT. Landsaw, Malaga, War Creek, Oakdale, Lower Buffalo, Hollonville, Pence, Enoch, Lane and Bethany around 1105 PM EDT. Booneville, Gentry, Yeadon, Paxton, Turin, Lexie, Lawson, Stay, Chenowee and Upper Gilmore around 1110 PM EDT. Jackson, Simpson, Elkatawa, Lerose, Shockey, Rosefork, Eversole, Moct, Chestnut Gap and Cowcreek around 1115 PM EDT. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 37 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
